text: Huang Xianfan (13 November 1899, China – 18 January 1982, People's Republic of China) was a Chinese historian, famous scholar and leader of the Bagui School and the Wunu School.«On Bagui School of Chinese Ethnology», Published by Guangxi Social Sciences, 7th- 11th Issues, 2008. He is considered by many to be the "Great Master of Zhuang Ethnic Research" for his writings about the ancient history of Zhuang Ethnic and Baiyue Ethnic.«A Master of Zhuang Ethnic Etudies», Published by the Guangxi's daily, on 3 September 2002. == Biography == During three periods of ethnic identification work after 1949, professors Fei Xiaotong, Huang Xianfan, Xia Kangnong and a lot of academic masters and scholars from anthropology and ethnic study circles made their great contributions. It was upon this research work of national ethnic identification that the State Council could be able to announce there are 56 ethnicities in China. This was a pioneering contribution to Chinese ethnic studies. In the mean time,the world ethnic study circles noticed this. This was the reason that ethnic study circles called professor Huang a founder of modern Chinese ethnic studies. == Books and treatise == * «Chieftain System in Western Guangxi», Published by seminar thesis on Zhuan and Yao ethnic history, the first collections, 1962 * «critical biography of WeiBaQun», Published by Guangxi Normal University Press, 2008. * «On the construction of Chinese Life science», Published by Guangxi Social Sciences, 3th Issues, 2007. == Related pages == *List of historians by continent == References == == Other websites == * Prefaced by 塚田诚之 * Prefaced by 马克·本德尔(Mark Bender) Category:1899 births Category:Chinese historians Category:Chinese academics Category:1982 deaths Category:Chinese scholars Category:People from Guangxi
